title: Crushed fingers, hands, mar India’s auto manufacturing hub
description: Poor training, shoddy equipment leave thousands of workers injured in India’s auto hub.

title: Colombian president’s son ‘won’t last’ in jail, defence lawyer warns
description: Both prosecution and defence in the case of Nicolas Petro have requested house arrest while the investigation proceeds.

title: Food prices rise after Russia ends grain deal, India restricts rice exports
description: There are new risks to global food prices after Russia exited grain deal and India restricted some rice exports.

title: Trump documents case: Ex-president pleads not guilty to additional charges
description: The added charges pertain to allegations Trump ordered security footage to be deleted in a classified documents probe.

title: Is the world’s biggest economy in trouble?
description: The White House lashes out at what it calls a 'flawed assessment' by Fitch Ratings.

title: West African leaders make plan for military intervention in Niger
description: Regional bloc ECOWAS works out potential operation to back up ultimatum to coup leaders to give up power by Sunday.

title: World’s oceans set new temperature record as global warming intensifies
description: The average ocean temperature has beat seasonal records since April of this year.

title: Photos: Hundreds protest as Lebanon marks third anniversary of Beirut blast
description: Three years on, investigation is virtually at a standstill, leaving survivors still yearning for answers.

title: Tunisian minister denies expulsion of Black refugees
description: NGO Avocats Sans Frontieres says Tunisia's expulsions are illegal, adding to the criticism of the government's actions.

title: Human Rights Watch urges US to stop atrocities in Sudan’s Darfur
description: The war in Sudan has been going on for more than 100 days, and Darfur is one of the worst hit areas of the country.

title: Uganda restoring colonial-era rail after China fails to fund another line
description: The line was built during British colonial rule and hasn’t been in use for nearly four decades.

title: Nigeria’s Tinubu seeks Senate support for ECOWAS intervention in Niger
description: Tinubu is reportedly seeking support to intervene against the ruling military in Niger, where a coup removed the gov't.

title: Trump election interference case: What happens next?
description: Former US president has pleaded not guilty to charges, but case could affect his 2024 re-election campaign. Here's how.

title: Ukrainian drones hit key Russian port, damage naval ship: Kyiv official
description: Moscow says it repels the attack on the port of Novorossiysk, which has a naval base, shipbuilding yards, oil terminal.

title: What is the Kuwaiti-Iranian dispute over the Dorra/Arash gas field?
description: The offshore field, known as Arash in Iran and Dorra in Kuwait and Saudi Arabia, has long been a source of contention.

title: Extreme heat hits Iraq, as temperatures exceed 50 degrees Celsius
description: Higher temperatures combine with Iraq's other problems to create a 'perfect storm'.

title: Russian court hands jailed Alexey Navalny new 19-year prison sentence
description: A constant thorn in Putin's side, Navalny said he expected a 'Stalinist' sentence on a slew of extremism charges.

title: Scepticism, uncertainty, hope: Haitians react to possible Kenya-led mission
description: People in Haiti express doubts over potential multinational force but say country can't fight gangs on its own.

title: Train collides with pick-up truck in Thailand, kills eight
description: Four people were injured in the crash at unauthorised crossing point in the Mueang district of Chachoengsao province.

title: Kremlin says interference of non-regional actors unlikely to help Niger
description: The Kremlin's comments come amid a pending regional military intervention and President Bazoum's call for Western help.

title: Brazil gold mine puts Indigenous territory ‘at risk’, advocates say
description: Families in the Para region are worried they will be displaced to make way for an open-pit mining project.

title: France: Deals revoked by Niger military were signed with ‘legitimate’ gov’t
description: Niger coup makers had revoked five military accords with France and suspended broadcasts of French state-funded outlets.

title: Biden’s asylum curbs at US-Mexico border can stay for now, court rules
description: Biden administration is appealing a legal challenge to policy restricting access to asylum at border with Mexico.

title: Lebanon marks three years since catastrophic Beirut port blast
description: As the country mourns more than 220 blast victims, rights groups decry lack of accountability among political leaders.

title: Romania releases influencer Andrew Tate from house arrest awaiting trial
description: The self-described misogynist, who is charged with rape and human trafficking, will not be able to leave the country.

title: China floods threaten downstream cities as tens of thousands evacuated
description: Typhoon Doksuri is wreaking havoc as it turns streets into rushing rivers and displaces thousands across east Asia.

title: Poles confident in security as Russian Wagner fighters operate near border
description: Many in Poland feel the Russian armed group has few options at its disposal to realistically endanger their security.

title: A widow keeps her husband’s memory alive, half a tank at a time
description: A car fuelled by memories may have to go, as cost of living and daily vehicle tolls affect a London mother's finances.

title: Palestinian teen killed by Israeli army in occupied West Bank
description: Mahmoud Abu Sa'an, 18, was killed during an Israeli raid on the Nur Shams refugee camp in Tulkarem, northern West Bank.

title: Ethiopia declares state of emergency following clashes in Amhara
description: The announcement comes as fighting across Ethiopia's second most populous region develops into a security crisis.

title: Who were the three Muslim men shot dead inside train by Indian armed guard?
description: A Railway Protection Force officer shot dead three Muslims and Hindu colleague and hailed PM Modi after the killings.

title: India’s Supreme Court suspends Rahul Gandhi’s defamation conviction
description: Congress leader was convicted in March for mocking PM Narendra Modi's surname and later removed as member of parliament.

title: Pakistan’s National Assembly likely to be dissolved on August 9
description: The assembly's dissolution will set the stage for general elections later this year.

title: Teacher stabbed at school in latest South Korean knife attack
description: A suspect has been apprehended in Daejeon following South Korea's second knife attack in two days.

title: China to drop tariffs on Australian barley amid diplomatic thaw
description: China's commerce ministry tariffs 'no longer necessary', while Australia drops trade complaint.

title: ‘Fit for pigs’: Conditions in overcrowded Zimbabwe prisons choke inmates
description: Former inmates of Zimbabwe's overburdened prisons say the conditions are inhumane. Activists blame government neglect.

title: Denmark to tighten border controls after Quran burnings
description: Border controls will initially be in place until August 10 as a means to prevent further protests from far-right groups.

title: Is Barbie feminist? Not for all women
description: The film's a marketing success, but its limited vision doesn't apply to most women, for whom the world is grim not pink

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 527
description: These are the main developments as the Russian invasion of Ukraine enters its 527th day.

title: Niger’s Bazoum warns of ‘devastating’ fallout for world if coup succeeds
description: President Mohamed Bazoum calls on international community to help country 'restore our constitutional order'.

title: Debt is America’s golden goose. Fitch can’t kill it
description: The world still wants to buy US debt, and the dollar's dominance won't be affected by the Fitch downgrade.

title: Hong Kong uses China playbook as crackdown turns to dissidents’ loved ones
description: Hong Kong authorities are targeting the relatives of activists overseas in latest sign of alignment with mainland China.
